page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content:
The area lies a few miles to the north of{Chelmsford}and takes in portions of two villages, {Little {Waltham}and{Broomfield.}
It is cut through by the{River {Chelmer}and the{A130}a very busy road linking Chelmsford with Braintree and North Essex.
The soil is loam,gravel and clay and the subsoil is sand,marl and clay. The majority of the land is farmland but it also includes woodland,gravel pits,a primary and a secondary school, a hospital,playing fields and a few shops.
Although some employment is available locally Chelmsford and London are the main job centres.
